qas.question: What is another name for denominational families?
What are the major branches of Protestantism?

answers.text: Adventist, Anglican, Baptist, Calvinist (Reformed), Lutheran, Methodist and Pentecostal

qas.question: What small branch of Protestantism will also be discussed?
What created the differentiation of Protestant branches?

answers.text: how they have been influenced by important movements since the Reformation

qas.question: What do some branches share in common?

context: Protestants can be differentiated according to <a3_0>how they have been influenced by important movements since the Reformation<a3_0/>, today regarded as branches. Some of these movements have a common <a4_0>lineage<a4_0/>, sometimes directly spawning individual denominations. Due to the earlier stated multitude of denominations, this section discusses only the largest denominational families, or <a0_0>branches<a0_0/>, widely considered to be a part of Protestantism. These are, in alphabetical order: <a1_0>Adventist, Anglican, Baptist, Calvinist (Reformed), Lutheran, Methodist and Pentecostal<a1_0/>. A small but historically significant <a2_0>Anabaptist<a2_0/> branch is also discussed.
